application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Loft conversion including rear roof extension incorporating a Juliet balcony, part rear roof extension to rear outrigger roof slope and (southern) side roof extension as well as installation of one roof light to front roof slope; single storey rear extension, following removal of rear addition; alteration to fenestration involving installation of windows and door to side and rear elevations and replacement of windows on front elevation; Addition of air conditioning condenser on main house flat roof.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):

Design, Access and Heritage statement (undated); E00 (Revision 00; dated 06/02/2019); E01 (Revision 00; dated 06/02/2019); E02 (Revision 00; dated 06/02/2019); E03 (Revision 00; dated 06/02/2019); E04 (Revision 00; dated 06/02/2019); E05 (Revision 00; dated 06/02/2019); E06 (Revision 00; dated 06/02/2019); E08 (Revision 00; dated 06/02/2019); E09 (Revision 00; dated 06/02/2019); P02 - Proposed Site Plan (Revision 02; dated 06/02/2019; as received 14/02/2022); P01 (Revision 02; dated 06/02/2019; as received 14/02/2022); P02 - Proposed First Floor Plan (Revision 02; dated 06/02/2019; as received 14/02/2022); P03 (Revision 02; dated 06/02/2019; as received 14/02/2022); P17 (Revision 02; dated 06/02/2019; as received 14/02/2022); P06 (Revision 02; dated 06/02/2019; as received 01/03/2022); P05 (Revision 02; dated 06/02/2019; as received 01/03/2022); P07 (Revision 02; dated 06/02/2019; as received 01/03/2022); P08 (Revision 02; dated 06/02/2019; as received 01/03/2022); DW01 - Existing and Proposed Section (Revision 00; dated 06/02/2019; as received 14/02/2022)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing dwelling, as per the submitted application form.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012.

| The hereby approved rooflight to the front roof slope of the hereby development shall be Conservation style rooflights and lie flush with the roof and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| The proposed second floor side windows shall contain only obscure glass and non-opening unless the parts of the window can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the rooms in which the windows are installed. The windows so approved shall be retained permanently

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy D5 of the London Plan (2021). | No operations (including site clearance and demolition) shall commence on site in connection with the development hereby approved until a scheme for the protection of existing trees, shrubs and hedgerows that are not proposed for removal has been submitted to and its installation on site has been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

All tree protection methods approved shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies G4, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021); policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines.
